revised_title: Cross-Section Measurements for Disintegrations Produced by Deuterons in Heavy Elements
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the cross-sections of disintegrations produced by deuterons in various heavy elements, such as platinum, gold, mercury, thallium, lead, bismuth, thorium, and uranium. They used deuterons of 9 MeV energy from the Cavendish cyclotron and determined the cross-sections for different reactions. The results provide insights into the mechanism of disintegrations caused by deuterons and contribute to the understanding of nuclear physics.
